channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report E-2023030719
item.description:
Report E-2023030719

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T14:00:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-29
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USU experienced a release of UN3266 "ZEP Microsolve Activator Solution" from a 55-gallon poly drum due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to 5' x 10' area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum and cleanup debris was then placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023031160
item.description:
Report X-2023031160

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-20
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 03/20/2033 at approximately 1602, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved notification from Employee 3633256 at the sorting facility in Salt Lake City, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The package contained an electric skateboard and is classified as UN 3171 battery-powered vehicles, under Special Provisions A214. The package was transported to the facility without the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork as per the IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023031150
item.description:
Report X-2023031150

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-21
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO LEAKING HAZMAT EXPLOSIVE 1.4C EMPLOYEE MOVED OFF BELT AND DISCOVERED IT WAS LEAKING SMALL AMOUNT OF BLACK POWDER LEAKED ON GROUND. UPON ARRIVING AND INSPECTING PACKAGE, RESPONDER, ACCORDING TO THE DECISION TREE AND AN OUTSIDE RESPONDER NEEDED TO RESPOND AREA WAS CORODONED OFF AND OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED.

item.title: Report E-2023030491
item.description:
Report E-2023030491

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-08
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 08, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printing ink (UN1210) was damaged due to container failure and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enviro Care (EC) to remediate the impacted surface. EC personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all printing ink impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023030816
item.description:
Report X-2023030816

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 3 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FROZEN JANEY LOUIS BAKERY PRODUCTS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023030570
item.description:
Report X-2023030570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE CLERK PROCESSING STATION. WEARING FULL PPE, RESPONDER NOTICED THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX WAS WET, RESPONDER OPENED IT AND FOUND THAT EACH CONTAINER WAS WET. THEN THE PACKAGE WAS PROCESSED FOLLOWING UPS DMP PROCEDURES

item.title: Report E-2023030153
item.description:
Report E-2023030153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-03
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal USU experienced a release of UN1908 Keeper Professional from a 30-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractor to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2' x 3' area of the trailer floor. The drum was placed into an overpack prior to contactors arrival. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All cleanup debris was collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023030057
item.description:
Report X-2023030057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-01
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO SIX PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EACH BOX CONTAINED APPROXIMATELY 2 KGS OF DRY ICE COOLING SIX PINTS OF ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZBA02310212061762, 1ZBA02310212401322, 1ZBA02310202268951, 1ZBA02310212426789 AND 1ZBA02310200391008. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER BA0231, SHIPPING DEPARTMENT, 2575 W 400 N, LINDON UT 84042.

item.description:
Report X-2023030221

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-27
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

DescribePack: No damage to hazardous items inside packaging with inspecting caps and leaks. Box is soiled and stained with the chemicals causing a stench. item.description:
Report X-2023021025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T13:57:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK BY A DRIVER BECAUSE IT WAS TORN OPEN. IT WAS NOT PACKED OR PADDED WITH ANY MATERIALS AND WAS TOO HEAVY FOR THE BOX. ACCORDING TO THE GOAL ZERO WEBSITE THE ITEM, YETI TANK, IS A LEAD ACID BATTERY. THE BOX DOES NOT STATE THAT A LEAD ACID OR NONSPILLABLE BATTERY WAS ENCLOSED. SPOKE WITH HMSC, UNDECLARED CONFIRMED.
